com.syjay.egl
Class GL

java.lang.Object
  com.syjay.egl.GL

public class GL
extends java.lang.Object

Implementaion of the whole 3D pipeline. We suggest you read The OpenGL Programming Guide - The Redbook, Chapter 1, 2, 3, 4, 9. http://www.opengl.org/documentation/red_book/

Field Detail

GL_TRIANGLES

public static final int GL_TRIANGLES
Treats each triplet of vertices as an independent triangle. Vertices 3n-2, 3n-1, and 3n define triangle n. N/3 triangles are drawn.

See Also:

Constructor Detail

GL

public GL(Renderer render)
Creates a new GL.
If glFlush() is called. The render() of the render will be called.

Parameters:
render - The renderer implementation which draw the entire 3D canvas.

glFrustum

public void glFrustum(int l,
                      int r,
                      int b,
                      int t,
                      int n,
                      int f)
glFrustum describes a perspective matrix that produces a perspective projection. (left,bottom,-near) and (right,top,-near) specify the points on the near clipping plane that are mapped to the lower left and upper right corners of the window, respectively, assuming that the eye is located at (0, 0, 0). -far specifies the location of the far clipping plane. Both near and far must be positive.

glGenTextures

public void glGenTextures(int n,
                          int[] textureNames)
glGenTextures returns n texture names in textures.

Parameters:
n - number of tex.
textureNames - array stores the tex names.

glDrawElements

public void glDrawElements(int mode,
                           int count,
                           int type,
                           int[] indices)
specifies multiple geometric primitives with very few subroutine calls.

Parameters:
mode - GL_TRIANGLES
count - number of points to be drawn
type - no use
indices - index array to be drawn
